These graphs show some parameters that affect fires from a forest park in the north of Portugal.
Temperature
Wind
Humidity
Burned Area


There are some standard parameters that serve as index for forest burnings. FFMC that shows how easily the particles of the upper part of the ground will burn, measuring the humidity of the same. DMC that shows the humidity of the vegetal material in the middle ground. DC that is related to the humidity content of the deepest layer of the ground. ISI that describes the propagation speed of the fire, from the combination of the wind and the FFMC. BUI describes the amount of fuel available for combustion, calculated from DMC and DC. Finally, the FWI, the meteorological index, that let us know the size of the fire, the caloric intensity.


Applying Machine Learning techniques with factors such as those presented above allows to predict quite accurately the range of the fire. However, predicting when a fire will occur is much more difficult, as there are many random factors that cannot be predicted. Despite this, there are factors that obviously increase the probability of fires.
